instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on boot
threads.message:
was slightly water damaged in the middle area on the board, not that bad, it was turning on when it arrived here
- than i put it in ultrasonic
-did not turn on
-after measuring around, seemed basically , so i reflowed the SMC, than it turn on again now, 
-i can do SMC reset, nvram reset, there is chima, backlight picture
-i can always go in the boot menu
-it starts from usb stick, or internal hdd, but arund halway of booting just hangs in there and wont go further

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on boot
threads.message: Tried known good HDD or HDD cable? Cable is very common to fail.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on boot
threads.message:
yes, i have a good test hdd, just used in another macbook, and i replaced the hdd cable

from usb it actually stuck halfway, on internal hdd it keeps restarting after about 1min of loading, and the line would reach abuot half way

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on boot
threads.message: Ughhhh yeah this one will really really suck. If you're for sure, the cable and all the internals are good (battery etc), this could be anything. What is your resistance to ground on PP3v42 with no power applied/battery plugged in?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on boot
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on boot
threads.message: Check your ram speed. These stall booting when using anything faster than PC-8500

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on boot
threads.message:
it actually works with PC-8500S 2x2 gb, customer upgraded to 2x8gb 12800, the max amount of ram is i think 8gb anyway
this is an old core2duo laptop

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on boot
threads.message: Put back PC3-8500 and test again...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on boot
threads.message: Yep there's the problem these HAVE to run with PC3-8500. Put the real RAM in and call it good.
